metadata.title: CVE-2023-2269 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A denial of service problem was found, due to a possible recursive lockingscenario, resulting in a deadlock in table_clear in drivers/md/dm-ioctl.cin the Linux Kernel Device Mapper-Multipathing sub-component.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-244-generic - 4.4.0-244.278~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-244-generic - 4.4.0-244.278~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-244-lowlatency - 4.4.0-244.278~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1122-aws - 4.4.0-1122.128
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1169-azure - 4.15.0-1169.184~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-244.278~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1122.128').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1169.184~14.04.1').
